title: Characteristics and Instruction of Pupils with Moderate/Severe Disabilities
description: Definition and social behavioral characteristics of students with moderate to severe disabilities. Instructional strategies emphasizing law, assessment, educational settings, and the collaborative strategies necessary for facilitating the inclusion of students with moderate/severe disabilities in general education settings. Emphasis on the communication, social skills, movement, mobility, sensory and specialized health care issues of students with moderate to severe disabilities. 3 seminars, 1 activity.
prerequisites: Acceptance into Level I Special Education Credential Program, EDUC 440
